He taught in Wu for fifty years.
In the first year of the Hongwu era, he was selected for his lofty conduct.

Later, he was granted permission to return to his hometown to spend his final years there.🔽Here is the corrected and aligned text:

was a person from Yin County, Ningbo.
He was proficient in both doctrinal studies and Chan practice, and his understanding was in accord with his practice.
He became a renowned monk of the time.
At first, he came from Fenglun on Mount Tiantai.
He ascended to become the abbot of Baotuo.

original: 匡眾說法恢復產業而振興叢席。
analyzed: 匡眾說法恢復產業而振興叢席。
translated: He guided the assembly in teaching the Dharma, revived the temple's income, and revitalized the monastic community.

analyzed: 洪武庚戌春正明部使者󱜁州劉君承直與師抱杖西東遊。
translated: In the spring of the Gengxu year of the Hongwu era, Liu Jun, the envoy of the Ministry of Rites in Zhejiang, traveled with the master from west to east.
The envoy said,
This is a pure and tranquil place.
I will build a pavilion for it.

original: 師乃建清淨境亭于寺之南嶺上。
analyzed: 師乃建清淨境亭于寺之南嶺上。
translated: The master then built the Pavilion of Pure and Tranquil Realm on the southern peak of the temple.
It was thirty feet high and as wide as it was long.
On the left, it leaned against the mountain, and on the right, it faced the tide.
Song Jinglian, a scholar of the Jingshan Academy, wrote a record for it.

original: 3 松江興聖寺沙門釋原真傳松江興聖寺沙門釋原真傳三釋原真號用藏。
analyzed: 3 松江興聖寺沙門釋原真傳松江興聖寺沙門釋原真傳三釋原真號用藏。
translated: 3. Biography of Shi Yuanzhen, Monk of Xingsheng Temple in Songjiang. Shi Yuanzhen, also known as Yongzang,
was a son of the Zhu family in Shanghai, Songjiang.

original: 出家受具興聖寺傳天台教觀。
analyzed: 出家受具興聖寺傳天台教觀。
translated: He left home and received full ordination at Xingsheng Temple, where he studied the Tiantai teachings and meditation.
His precepts were pure and his knowledge was vast.

original: 精修法華彌陀懺法。🔽暇則書法華諸經。
analyzed: 精修法華彌陀懺法。 暇則書法華諸經。
translated: He diligently practiced the Lotus Sutra and Amitabha Repentance.🔽In his spare time, he wrote the Lotus Sutra and various sutras.
He expounded the Dharma according to conditions and sat in meditation until dawn.
In the second year of Hongwu, he fell slightly ill.
He bathed, wrote a verse to inform the assembly, and said:
For forty-two years,
there was no practice and no cultivation.
There was birth and there was death.
The great ocean is just a single bubble.
True return is no return.
The mind is empty and pure, wandering freely.
He sat in full lotus position and passed away peacefully.

original: 4 杭州上天竺寺沙門釋慧日傳杭州上天竺寺沙門釋慧日傳四栢子庭釋慧日號東溟。

translated: 4. Biography of Shi Huirui, Monk of Shangtiantong Temple in Hangzhou. Shi Huirui was called Dongming.
He was a son of the Tiantai Jia family.
He was a descendant of Jia Sidao, the prime minister of the Song dynasty.
When Sidao was exiled, the master was still young.

original: 志求出家依縣之廣嚴寺平山和尚。
analyzed: 志求出家依縣之廣嚴寺平山和尚。
translated: He aspired to become a monk and relied on Master Pingshan of Guangyan Temple in the county.
After several years, he shaved his head and received full ordination.

original: 年二十二聞栢子庭講台教於赤城師趨座下。
analyzed: 年二十二聞栢子庭講台教於赤城師趨座下。
translated: At the age of twenty-two, he heard that Baizi Ting was lecturing on Tiantai teachings in Chicheng. The master went to his seat.
Before long, he was able to grasp the great meaning.
Baizi Ting sighed and said,

original: 投丸於峻坂不足以喻其機之疾也。
analyzed: 投丸於峻坂不足以喻其機之疾也。
translated: Throwing a ball on a steep slope is not enough to compare with the speed of his understanding.
Will my way greatly flourish through him?

original: 自是師之學沈浸醲郁而名重一時矣。
analyzed: 自是師之學沈浸醲郁而名重一時矣。
translated: From then on, the master's learning became more profound and his reputation became great in one generation.
One day, he took a nap.

original: 恍見竹橫地下竹上凝者白粥粲然。
analyzed: 恍見竹橫地下竹上凝者白粥粲然。
translated: He vaguely saw bamboo lying on the ground, with white porridge congealing on the bamboo.
The master lay on the ground and ate it.
After waking up, he told Baizi Ting about it.
Ting explained, saying,
Bamboo and porridge have the same sound.
You got to eat the porridge on the ground.
It is probably not a coincidence that you are destined to be in the upper or lower Tianzhu.

original: 於是渡錢塘謁竹屋淨法師于上竺。
analyzed: 於是渡錢塘謁竹屋淨法師于上竺。
translated: He then crossed the Qiantang River and visited Chan Master Zhuwu Jing at Shangzang.
The room he was staying in was rather low and damp.
So he wrote a poem about it.
Chan Master Zhuwu saw the poem and said to the assembly:
This child is extraordinary.
In the future, he will be the abbot of this mountain.
He cannot be dismissed because of his young age.
So he treated him as a guest and friend.

original: 無何命典客寮尋掌僧籍。
analyzed: 無何命典客寮尋掌僧籍。
translated: Soon, he was appointed to the guest reception office and later took charge of the monks' records.

original: 竹屋化去時湛堂澄公繼其席。
analyzed: 竹屋化去時湛堂澄公繼其席。
translated: When Chan Master Zhuwu passed away, Chan Master Zhantang Cheng succeeded him as abbot.
He appreciated Chan Master Wuming and invited him to the rear hall.
After more than a year, he left to be the abbot of Shengshui on Mount Wu.
In the fourth year of the Zhizheng era of the Yuan dynasty, he became the abbot of Jinfeng.
After three years, Tianzhu suffered a disaster.
Yuanchen Gao Nalin invited Chan Master Wuming to rebuild it.
The temple buildings were completed, and Wang Yan wrote a record for it.
In the fourth year, he moved to Shangzang.
Chan Master Wuming knew that his fate was there and was diligent day and night.
He completely repaired everything in the temple.

original: 元順帝聞特賜慈光妙應普濟之號。
analyzed: 元順帝聞特賜慈光妙應普濟之號。
translated: The Yuan Emperor Shun heard of him and specially bestowed the title of Compassionate Light, Wonderful Response, and Universal Salvation
And a golden-threaded robe to honor him.

original: 十六年退隱于會稽巖󱐙間。
analyzed: 十六年退隱于會稽巖󱐙間。
translated: In the sixteenth year, he retired and secluded himself in the mountains and valleys of Mount Tiantai in Zhejiang.
No one recognized him.
The Yuan prime minister Darishan sent an envoy
To search for him and invited him back to the mountain.
He resided at Upper Tianzhu for twenty-five years in total.

original: 至我　　皇明太祖洪武二年　　詔赴蔣山佛會。
analyzed: 至我　　皇明太祖洪武二年　　詔赴蔣山佛會。
translated: In the second year of Hongwu in the great Ming Dynasty, the emperor ordered him to attend the Buddhist assembly at Mount Jianguo.
He ordered the Ministry of Rites to provide meals.
The next day, he summoned him to the Fengtian Palace.
The hundred officials all gathered, and the monks were like a school of fish.

original: 惟師臘最高朱顏白眉班居前列　　上親問昇濟沈冥之道。
analyzed: 惟師臘最高朱顏白眉班居前列　　上親問昇濟沈冥之道。
translated: Only the master, being the oldest in age with ruddy complexion and white eyebrows, was placed in the front row. The emperor personally asked about the way to rescue and liberate the suffering beings.

original: 師備奏稱旨　太祖顧謂僧眾曰。
analyzed: 師備奏稱旨　太祖顧謂僧眾曰。
translated: The master fully explained it, and the emperor was delighted. The Taizu looked at the assembly of monks and said:

original: 邇來學佛者惟飽餐優游沈薶歲月。
analyzed: 邇來學佛者惟飽餐優游沈薶歲月。
translated: In recent years, those who study Buddhism only eat well, relax, and waste their years.

original: 如金剛楞伽心經皆攝心之要與。
analyzed: 如金剛楞伽心經皆攝心之要與。
translated: The Diamond Sutra, Lankavatara Sutra, and Heart Sutra are all essential for concentrating the mind.
Why not thoroughly investigate its meaning?

original: 今有不通者當質諸白眉法師。
analyzed: 今有不通者當質諸白眉法師。
translated: Those who do not understand it now should ask the Dharma Master Bai Mei.

analyzed: 自後召見　　太祖但以白眉呼之而不名也。
translated: Later, when summoned to see the Taizu, he was only called Bai Mei and not by his name.

original: 甞與別峯同法師金碧峯禪師輩賜食禁中。
analyzed: 甞與別峯同法師金碧峯禪師輩賜食禁中。
translated: Once, together with the Dharma Master Bie Feng and the Chan Master Jin Bi Feng, they were given food in the inner palace.

original: 因奏瓦棺寺乃隋智者大師釋法華之所不可從廢　　太祖命就天界別建室廬以存其跡。

translated: They reported that Wa Guan Temple was where the Sui Dynasty Chan Master Shi Fa Hua of Tian Tai School lectured on the Lotus Sutra, and it should not be abandoned. The Taizu ordered a separate building to be constructed at Tian Jie to preserve its traces.
The edict ordered him to open the mountain and expound the Dharma.

original: 五年孟春復於鍾山建水陸大齊。
analyzed: 五年孟春復於鍾山建水陸大齊。
translated: In the fifth year, in the first month of spring, he again held a grand water and land ritual on Zhong Mountain.

original: 命師說毘尼戒　　太祖親率百僚臨聽。
analyzed: 命師說毘尼戒　　太祖親率百僚臨聽。
translated: He was ordered to expound the Vinaya precepts, and the Taizu personally led the hundred officials to listen.
After the event was completed, he took leave to return to Shang Zhu.

original: 謝院事日修彌陀懺以臻淨業。
analyzed: 謝院事日修彌陀懺以臻淨業。
translated: On the day of resigning from the abbot's position, he performed the Amitabha Repentance to attain pure practices.
In the twelfth year, on the first day of the seventh month in autumn, he dreamed one night.

original: 青蓮花生方池中芬芳襲人。
analyzed: 青蓮花生方池中芬芳襲人。
translated: A blue lotus flower grew in a square pond, with its fragrance permeating the surroundings.
When he woke up, he told the assembly, saying:
The auspicious signs of my rebirth in the Pure Land are now evident.
In the human world, it is almost not far away.
Four days later, he sat in the lotus position, joined his palms, and passed away.
His worldly age was eighty-nine.
His years as a monk were seventy-three.

original: 越十日奉全身藏于寺之西峯妙應塔院。
analyzed: 越十日奉全身藏于寺之西峯妙應塔院。
translated: Ten days later, his entire body was enshrined in the Miaoying Pagoda in the west peak of the temple.
The master's physical body was tall and majestic.
His eyebrows were over an inch long.
The pupils of his eyes gleamed and shot out at people.
But people, whether old or young, saw the master enter the city.
They all called out:
Here comes our White Eyebrowed Venerable!
They competed to hold incense and flowers to scatter upon him.
The master's face was stern and cold, and he never spoke idly.

original: 甞對王公大臣未出一軟媚語。
analyzed: 甞對王公大臣未出一軟媚語。
translated: He never uttered a soft flattering word when facing kings, officials, or ministers.

original: 至於誘引後學其辭色溫如春曦。
analyzed: 至於誘引後學其辭色溫如春曦。
translated: As for guiding and inspiring later students, his words and demeanor were as gentle as the spring sun.
Therefore, many people were delighted to follow his teachings.

original: 嗣法有思濟行樞允鑑允忠良謹普智文會元秀景梵等若干人。
analyzed: 嗣法有思濟行樞允鑑允忠良謹普智文會元秀景梵等若干人。
translated: Those who succeeded him in inheriting the Dharma included Si Ji, Xing Chu, Yun Jian, Yun Zhong, Liang Jin, Pu Zhi, Wen Hui, Yuan Xiu, Jing Fan, and several others.

original: 5 杭州集慶寺沙門釋土璋傳杭州集慶寺沙門釋土璋傳五天心瑩絕宗繼釋士璋字原璞。
analyzed: 5 杭州集慶寺沙門釋土璋傳杭州集慶寺沙門釋土璋傳五天心瑩絕宗繼釋士璋字原璞。
translated: Biography 5 of Shi Tu Zhang, Monk of Jietan Temple in Hangzhou, Hangzhou Biography 5 of Shi Tu Zhang, Monk of Jietan Temple in Hangzhou, Hangzhou Tianxin Ying Juezong Jishi Shi Zhang, whose name was Yuan Pu.
He was the son of the Wang family in Haining County.
From birth, his forehead was pierced by a rhinoceros horn.

original: 目炯炯黑如點漆。🔽幼即羶葷弗御。
analyzed: 目炯炯黑如點漆。 幼即羶葷弗御。
translated: His eyes were bright and black like lacquer.🔽From a young age, he did not eat meat or pungent foods.

original: 父母或陰試之輒嘔不止。
analyzed: 父母或陰試之輒嘔不止。
translated: His parents would sometimes secretly test him, but he would vomit and not stop.
He enjoyed reading Buddhist scriptures.
Next to his house, there was a temple monk.
He asked his father, saying:
This is a seed of the Śākya clan.
Why don't you let him be my disciple?
His father angrily said:
My son is like a lotus flower.
He is not of the same kind as you.
Thus, he was given to the monk and received the five precepts.

original: 時翰林侍制柳貫甞憩寺舍。
analyzed: 時翰林侍制柳貫甞憩寺舍。
translated: At that time, Liu Guan, the attendant of the Hanlin Academy, once rested in the temple.
He loved the master and taught him the classics and histories.
He personally explained the profound meanings.
The master heard and immediately understood.
At the age of nineteen, he shaved his head and became a fully ordained monk.
Master Wuyan of An Temple was the abbot of Tianzhu.
The master was about to carry his luggage and follow him as an attendant.
Suddenly he dreamed of wandering in a treasure place.

original: 有大菩薩教其胡跪作禮口宣懺文。
analyzed: 有大菩薩教其胡跪作禮口宣懺文。
translated: There was a great bodhisattva who taught him to kneel and make prostrations, reciting the text of repentance with his mouth.

original: 覺而思之乃普賢淨行品偈文。
analyzed: 覺而思之乃普賢淨行品偈文。
translated: When he woke up, he thought about it and it was the verses of the chapter on Samantabhadra's Pure Practices.
Sure enough, he saw Wuyan looking at him with wide eyes.

original: 凡天台教觀一家章義以次授師。
analyzed: 凡天台教觀一家章義以次授師。
translated: He was taught the meaning of the chapters of the Tiantai teachings and contemplations in order.

original: 而志慮專一力學無怠至忘寢食。
analyzed: 而志慮專一力學無怠至忘寢食。
translated: But his aspirations were focused and his learning was diligent to the point of forgetting sleep and food.

original: 我庵陰鑒其勤常以遠大期之。
analyzed: 我庵陰鑒其勤常以遠大期之。
translated: Wuyan secretly observed his diligence and always expected great things from him.

original: 時有天心瑩素亢不服人。
analyzed: 時有天心瑩素亢不服人。
translated: At that time, there was Xinyin Ying, who was arrogant and did not submit to others.
Therefore, the world called him a tiger of righteousness.
He also admired the master's conduct and made an appointment with him to study together.

original: 日與磨切詰難極於毫芒。
analyzed: 日與磨切詰難極於毫芒。
translated: Day and night, they honed their skills and debated to the utmost extent.
The crowd said they were a pair of jades.
After a long time, Wuyan passed away.

original: 東溟日公補其席陶冶學者。
analyzed: 東溟日公補其席陶冶學者。
translated: Dongming Ri, the abbot of Tianzhu, took his place and refined the students.
He selected the master to be the examiner.
He was appointed as the guest prefect and later took charge of the confession ceremony.

original: 元至正十三年受命住持棲真。
analyzed: 元至正十三年受命住持棲真。
translated: In the thirteenth year of the Zhizheng era of the Yuan dynasty, he was ordered to serve as the abbot of Qizhen.

original: 而寺與南竺演福二剎相隣。
analyzed: 而寺與南竺演福二剎相隣。
translated: The temple was adjacent to the two monasteries of Nanji Yanshou and Fusi.

original: 時有大用才絕宗繼二老居之。
analyzed: 時有大用才絕宗繼二老居之。
translated: At that time, there were two elders named Dayong Cai and Juezong Ji living there.

original: 師尤以學未足日往扣焉。
analyzed: 師尤以學未足日往扣焉。
translated: The master, feeling that his studies were insufficient, went to visit them every day.

original: 凡教觀之奧偏圓本跡之微一一無不條柝。
analyzed: 凡教觀之奧偏圓本跡之微一一無不條柝。
translated: The subtleties of the profound teachings and contemplations, the distinctions between the provisional and the real, were all thoroughly analyzed by him.
Therefore, he once sighed in front of the assembly, saying:
The teachings and canon of Buddhism are vast like the ocean.
It is certainly not something that can be fully understood by one's own goodness alone.
If I were to stop here and not make further progress,
how could I avoid the criticism of being ignorant?
In the twentieth year, he moved to serve as the abbot of Jingde.
In the last years of the Yuan dynasty, the world was in great turmoil with warfare.
People all thought of hiding themselves.
The master alone focused his mind on temple affairs.
He did not change his resolve due to the difficulties of the times.

original: 其彰善癉惡風彩為之改觀。
analyzed: 其彰善癉惡風彩為之改觀。
translated: His conduct of promoting goodness and reprimanding evil changed people's views.
He accepted the pure assembly and lectured on the sutras and commentaries every day.
There was not a moment of leisure.

original: 至我　　皇明洪武集慶虛席。
analyzed: 至我　　皇明洪武集慶虛席。
translated: When the great Ming dynasty was established, the seat of Jingshan was vacant.

original: 郡守李公請就提唱教乘。
analyzed: 郡守李公請就提唱教乘。
translated: The prefect Li invited him to expound the teachings.
After a few days, he received an imperial decree.

original: 俾浙之東西五府名剎住持咸集京師。
analyzed: 俾浙之東西五府名剎住持咸集京師。
translated: It ordered the abbots of the famous monasteries in the east and west of Zhejiang to all gather in the capital.
Together they built Tianjie and established the Shanshi Institute.
Using it to unify the monks and jointly supervise the work.
The elders of all directions did not know what to do.
The master alone came up with a plan that was well-organized.
At that time, the hundred thousand people all followed his method.

original: 是年六月既望預知時至。
analyzed: 是年六月既望預知時至。
translated: On the sixteenth day of the sixth month of that year, he knew the time of his death was approaching.
He summoned his disciples and entrusted them with his later affairs.
